channel.title: Window closes to fast? Use this!
channel.description:
If the window closes to quickly then run from the command prompt found at:
Start - All programs - Accessories - Command Prompt.
When you open it type the address of your run_server for example:
cd c:\Users\YOURNAME\Desktop\Easyrsc\Server\run(compile - or which ever you want)
The "cd" at the begining tells the computer to change the current dir to the one you type in and must be added!!!
This windows will not close unless told to so you can look at the error given.
This is another way instead of using pause as this doesnt always work/people dont no what they are doing.
Hope this helps. :D :D
Spam if you like i dont care but ive been asked this question before so it might be usefull to others.

item.title: Window closes to fast? Use this!
item.dc:creator: @pesterd pesterd
item.description:
@pesterd wrote:

Go to your Ant/Bin

Open up ant.bat and runant.bat

Type Pause at the end of both and save.

Thats another way to do it…
Rep me NAOWW :) Haha JK but seriously you guys can do that as well

Read full topic
item.source: Window closes to fast? Use this!

item.title: Window closes to fast? Use this!

item.description:
@bengina wrote:

If the window closes to quickly then run from the command prompt found at:

Command Prompt.

When you open it type the address of your run_server for example:

cd c:\Users\YOURNAME\Desktop\Easyrsc\Server\run(compile - or which ever you want)

The “cd” at the begining tells the computer to change the current dir to the one you type in and must be added!!!

This windows will not close unless told to so you can look at the error given.

This is another way instead of using pause as this doesnt always work/people dont no what they are doing.

Hope this helps.
